events.description: The Admiral tells his assistant to log the movements on Cherry Tree Lane.
events.discussion: Discuss the technique of logging actions, and its benefits in the context of audits.

events.description: A strong wind blows all the candidate nannies away.
events.discussion: Discuss adversarial strategies to eliminate competition, and what you consider fair or not.

events.description: Mary Poppins empties her bag, from which she extracts all sorts of things, but which apparently seems empty. She states “Never judge things by their appearance”.
events.discussion: Discuss the techniques used for hiding information, e.g., steganography, and the motivations behind a party deciding to use such techniques.

events.description: Whilst tidying the nursery, Michael is trapped in the wardrobe and cannot get out.
events.discussion: Discuss the security backfiring effects of using certain practices.

events.description: Mary Poppins opens the front door by simply tapping her umbrella on the floor.
events.discussion: Discuss the importance of controlling access to a resource, and how access can be granted or denied (authentication triad).

events.description: Burt recognizes Mary Poppins simply by her profile, which he draws with chalk on the pavement.
events.discussion: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of biometric identification.

events.description: Michael and Jane are wearing a safety belt on the merry-go-round, while Mary and Burt are not.
events.discussion: This simple security mechanism may go unnoticed, but it is important for the safety of the young horse riders.

events.description: Michael is bullied into opening a bank account
events.discussion: Discuss the impact of peer-pressure on decision which affect the security of personal property, information and well-being.

events.description: Panic erupts in the bank, as customers fear the bank has no cash. Security procedures are immediately put in place, e.g., closing the bank.
events.discussion: In a situation of panic, security measures are often put in place. Discuss examples of this, debating benefits and shortcomings of such measures.

events.description: Both Michael and Jane accidentally are sucked up a chimney.
events.discussion: Physical security is often linked to knowledge of information, and disclosing this information is important. A lack of communication, like in the case of this scene, caused the two children to place themselves in potential danger.

events.description: The Admiral shoots fireworks to the chimney sweepers, and they escape.
events.discussion: Discuss the security procedures to be adopted in case of an attack such as the one in the scene.

events.description: Mr Banks is escorted to the meeting room in the bank.
events.discussion: Discuss the topic of revocation of rights and procedures to handle the situation.
